alert.note: Alert for Central Yampa River Basin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 12 at 2:47PM MST until January 13 at 7:00AM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM MST SATURDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches with locally higher amounts possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Central Yampa River Basin. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 7 AM MST Saturday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Saturday evening through Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Despite minor snowfall accumulations tonight, blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility, especially in open areas. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. A detailed map of the snowfall can be found at: www.weather.gov/gjt/winter.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
